page.title: 15 Community Organisations
page.content: The Yorkshire Countrywomens Association, formed in 1983, aims to further the skills,knowledge and social activities of its members and to preserve the heritage of Yorkshire. The Darby and Joan Club is an extension of the W.R.V.S. The Braithwell group was formed in 1947. Its object is to provide entertainment and company for pensioners and lonely people. The Good Companions have been helping people in need in the local community, since 1966, such as arranging transport for hospital appointments and visits to patients. At Christmas each Senior Citizen is given a monetary gift. Many sick people benefit from the generosity of the Community Association, formed in 1967, primarily to raise funds for the church. Girl Guides & Brownies use the porta cabin on the field.
